channel.title: CPR/First Aid certification
channel.description:
Was eating some chips earlier when I nearly choked on a Doritos and it reminded me that I used to be certified.(Thankfully I caught it just in time before it got caught in my throat and was able to force it back out lol)
I haven't been certified in either one for a good two years now. As a few of you know I am somewhat tight on money so I'd much rather find a "free" place to get re-certified if at all possible. I remember hearing a while back about a few places but I can't remember the names of them now. I might even consider putting $10 or something into it.
So yeah I would like to get re-certified. If anybody knows of a place that does anything relative to this for a cheap/free free please list them below. Please note it would have to be done either online ( if possible? ), or in the state of Georgia, USA.

item.title: CPR/First Aid certification
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:14, topic:527695”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=646448.msg4348120#msg4348120 date=1376205583]
My senior first aid was about $180…
[/quote]

Did you do the one day course with St Johns?[/quote]
I don’t know if it was the one day course, but it was with St Johns. iirc it was over 3 days

Read full topic

item.description:

My senior first aid was about $180…

Did you do the one day course with St Johns?

item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Wow. What all does your first aid class cover?

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: CPR/First Aid certification
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

$200 for a first aid cert? My 140 hour emergency medical technician class cost $350. I could never imagine a first aid class costing that much.

Read full topic

item.title: CPR/First Aid certification
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

I know that some workplaces will pay the fee of the course, you could speak to your manager about it. The fee where I live was around 200$ for the full senior first aid certificate and the company I work for were able to fully reimburse the cost. You can also claim the fee on tax (that may also depend on where you live, I’m not sure how American tax works in these situations).

Read full topic

item.title: CPR/First Aid certification
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:8, topic:527695”][quote author=Java-RSPS-Noob link=topic=646448.msg4347459#msg4347459 date=1376093616]
A friend tipped me off that I might be able to get some training at the fire department so might try there next.
[/quote]

Which will most likely still cost $fee if they go through red cross or another organization.[/quote]
The classes are 100% for people to run, which is why I never understood the fees. Usually, the only thing you have to pay for is the physical CPR card. Fire departments are a good one to check, because I know at least 3 people at my department that are certified to teach CPR, and are always more than willing to hold a free class.

Read full topic

item.title: CPR/First Aid certification
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Java-RSPS-Noob:

A friend tipped me off that I might be able to get some training at the fire department so might try there next.

Which will most likely still cost $fee if they go through red cross or another organization.

Read full topic

item.title: CPR/First Aid certification
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:6, topic:527695”]Check with a local swimming pool on where to find a class.
(I have been a swim coach for years now and go through the redcross via the city)[/quote]Red-Cross it’s 20$ fee for each one.

[hr]

[quote=“m.dog311, post:5, topic:527695”]Where do you live? Check with your local hospitals, ambulance services, etc. I know where I live (Western Pennsylvania) most health centers offer the class for free/very cheap. CPR re-certification is a requirement for almost every position in the medical field, so the classes are extremely common.[/quote] I haven’t found any free ones for outsiders. They are only free if you are an employee or are under certain “circumstances”

[hr]

A friend tipped me off that I might be able to get some training at the fire department so might try there next.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: CPR/First Aid certification
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Where do you live? Check with your local hospitals, ambulance services, etc. I know where I live (Western Pennsylvania) most health centers offer the class for free/very cheap. CPR re-certification is a requirement for almost every position in the medical field, so the classes are extremely common.

Read full topic

item.title: CPR/First Aid certification
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:2, topic:527695”]It’s not always that bad if the chip goes past choking distance, you can sometimes divert it down the correct pipe. This might be a dumb question, but why do you need to get certified? Surely there are plenty of free resources on the Internet?[/quote]I used to stay certified all the time but when I changed career paths from Education to Industrial Administration I just never had a need for it, but after today’s experience it just reminded me how ti can be useful in case it happens to somebody in the world and you are near by.

[hr]

[quote=“Arcik, post:3, topic:527695”]I don’t know how it works in the US but sometimes in the UK you can do it all government funded (free). Re qualifying would cost under £50 otherwise. It might be the same in the US too?[/quote]There are some government agencies that do it but they normally charge way up in the 30-50$ range as well.

Read full topic

item.title: CPR/First Aid certification
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

I don’t know how it works in the US but sometimes in the UK you can do it all government funded (free). Re qualifying would cost under £50 otherwise. It might be the same in the US too?

Read full topic

item.title: CPR/First Aid certification
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

It’s not always that bad if the chip goes past choking distance, you can sometimes divert it down the correct pipe. This might be a dumb question, but why do you need to get certified? Surely there are plenty of free resources on the Internet?

Read full topic
